column4: Hey all. Random odd thing that more or less happened recently: my sound 'died'. Alsamixer, and lspci and aplay -l all show my card just fine, just that the Ubuntu sound settings show zero hardware, just a blank 'hardware' tab. Any ideas?
also, have you checked for updates / upgraded recently?
I did some updates recently, though none of them seemed to have anything to do with Alsa nor the kernel ... (I think)
well, it is more probable that an update caused it than it occured on its own
try running sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get upgrade
only flash and nautilus to upgrade
hm... what kind of device are you using? onboard or pci?
pcie
aplay -l
card 1: XFi [Creative X-Fi], device 0: ctxfi [Front/WaveIn] and others like it
On a side note, I've had that card working flawlessly for the past several months
ok, so kernel notices it... Do you have kernel modules loaded for it (does it require?)

the only thing I noticed was this: $ pulseaudio                                                                                                                                                                           (03-05 18:50)
which I'm currently trying to figure out cause I guess that might and would be the issue ...
of course, you could try reinstalling pulseaudio
installing stuff I know, but how do I reinstall a package?
apt-get remove && apt-get install
o, that way. :)
...jsut wondering, any possibility that you're running 12.04 beta?
As much as I love cutting edge stuff like Arch, no ... I'm too old for that. Nominally stable 11.10
ouch
thanks for the ideas and helping out. Many thanks sir.
